reviewText:
We were going to a night at the museum event, and my son was begging me for this badge. He loves watching YouTube videos on Five Nights at Freddys, and he had seen a Freddy Fazbear badge advertised on one of the sites. So, I turned to Amazon, and of course I found this badge. Honestly, I wasn't sure that it would be worth $15, but as I received, I found that the badge appeared to be in good shape, and made with good quality metal. It wasn't made with flimsy or cheap plastic. The badge attached to his shirt, and almost weighs down the cotton (it might be better to wear this badge with a more solid, stronger shirt or vest). The backing of the pen was easy to unhook and hook, and the clasp really hooks the pin in tight so it won't get loose or fall off of his shirt. The only thing I didn't like with the pin piece is that it is quite long, and the sharp metal pin would bother my son as he was wearing it. This part needs to be a little shorter, but other than that, my son is having a blast with this!

4/16/16 UPDATE: I'm updating my review to say that while my son had fun with this pin, it only lasted 2 months!! The pin backing came off, and we're not able to hook it back on. It's really disappointing that he can't continue to wear it. I guess this pin would be okay for a one time use at a birthday party or other event, but it's not going to last for kids wanting to continue to wear it/play with it. Very disappointed!!
summary: My son had fun with it, but it only lasted 2 months!! Pin backing came off!

reviewText: This is a really cute top and it's flattering to figure. Yes I would purchase again in another color

The shirt drapes beautifully and is true to size including a perfect length. What I find disappointing in women's clothes in the past ten years is the increase use of polyester. Though the description says chiffon, chiffon is a description of the type of weave. Nylon chiffon replaced silk chiffon in the 1930's. The 1960's saw the immersion of polyester chiffon. To find an all linen, wool, silk or even cotton top these days, one must look among men's shirts or a high end fashion brand. Polyester is excruciating to wear in Arizona as it does not breath. Will send back and will go back to less purchases but luxury brands.
summary: Chiffon describes the type of weave not the material

This is an averaged score, as I love one of the four of these shirts that I ordered.  If they were all like the vintage turquoise one I received, this would be a five-star review.  Unfortunately, the h charcoal, black, and white shirts I ordered were not scoop-neck shirts, but v-neck shirts, and the materials were not consistent.  I really need scoop-neck tees in order to wear them with sweaters with more generous neck-lines. The vintage turquoise one I ordered is a nice, soft 50% poly 25% cotton 25% rayon jersey fabric.  The white is 95% cotton 5% spandex.  The black and gray are 92% cotton 8%spandex, So those three are being returned.  I do wish I could get scoop-neck shirts in those colors, preferably in the poly-cotton-rayon jersey blend, but I'd settle just for the neck-line as advertised.  If I could, this would be a 5 star review, as I really like the one that is actually as described.
summary: Says it's a scoop tee--I received v-necks in a different fabric.

So far, everything I have ordered from Zxzy has been great quality and very well made! This is no exception, except for the fact that it doesn't exactly look like the sweater dress pictured. It is very similar, but not exact~I ordered up knowing that this is a chinese company and their sizing always runs small. After receiving this, I noticed that it doesn't hang off the shoulder at all, it's more of a boatneck collar, which is fine, just not what I was expecting. I did contact Zxzy about returning the dress and they were very accommodating in the process and asked very specific questions about what I expected from my original purchase, how I thought it could be changed to be more like the dress represented, etc. They did quickly process my exchange and re-sent me a larger size(I was hoping a larger size would offer me more room in the shoulders to make it "off shoulder", it didn't~But, it's still really cute on). The shipping was much faster than originally estimated, and the exchange was even faster than the original! I did receive this at a promotional price, but I will absolutely purchase again from Zxzy again! Cute clothes at affordable prices and Great Customer Service!!

My bride attempted to make things easier on us and pick a style online that we could all order for ourselves. There was an option to email the seller and provide my measurements, so I thought it was really pretty clear what my sizes are. I was impressed that my dress arrived faster than I thought it would. It's a beautiful dress but it was just... off. If that makes sense? The bottom was way too long, and I don't understand that since I gave my measurements and height. The middle fit well enough. The top part was a disaster. You don't wear a strapless bra with it, and I was fine with that since there was plenty of support. It was almost like they took a chest frame and sewed it in there haha. I don't really know how to explain it. So after fooling with it, we got it zipped. The thing was practically sideways on me. The one shoulder had to practically leave the room to straighten up the rest of the dress. You can't cut it and resew the top because of weird boob plate thing. So basically the dress was useless to us and I decided to send it back. Luckily the seller did say I could have a refund if I sent the dress back. This is where I should have been more careful on who I was ordering from, because in order to send it back - to China! -  I'd need to pay $65! I'd already spent $100 on it, plus an additional $25 or 30 to rush it, and now another $65 to send it back?! Plus they said it would be at least 5-6 weeks to receive it. I said forget it. That was the final straw for me. I ended up just donating it to a daycare for dress-up play time.

I ordered this dress in green and black, both size 12, in order to decide which color I preferred to wear to an upcoming military ball. Unfortunately, I will be returning both of them.

First, the positives:
This dress is very pretty. The green was exactly as pictured and the lace is very nice. The dress appears to be well made and the fabric has a nice weight to it.

Unfortunately, even going by the size guide for the dress, I found the dress to be significantly smaller than advertised. In particular, it's about 3" shorter than it says. I ordered a 12, which according the size guide should be 60" long. I measure the dress on a hanger at 57" from shoulder to hem. On me, it hangs about 55.5" from the shoulder. I'm 5'7" and measure 58" from shoulder to floor so this doesn't work, even if I'm not wearing heels. The bust is also about an inch smaller than advertised. I am very busty (34DD) and I measure about 39.5" with a bra on, so I was expecting it to be a little bit tight, as the listed measurement is 38.5". I was not expecting to be squished completely flat. Measuring over the dress, I measured the bust at closer to 37.5". The measurements for the waist and hip seem to be accurate, and there's enough stretch to accommodate my 43" hips without it pulling too tight.

If I had only ordered one of these dresses, I might chalk the differences up to poor quality control or a fluke. But I ordered two in different colors and both fit exactly the same.

It's also worth noting that (at least on me) the V in the neck comes down pretty low. Not necessarily a bad thing, but I wasn't expecting it to be as low as it was based on the picture.

Overall, it is a really nice dress, especially for the price, and has the potential to be very flattering on someone whose measurements match the dress.

I've attached pictures. In the green, I am barefoot, in the black I am wearing about 3" heels.
summary: Great Dress, but Size is Not Accurate

reviewText:
I am updating my review, and adding 2 more stars.  CoolBell reached out to me after reading my review, and offered to refund 1/2 the price of the bag (which I though a little odd), or to resend me another bag as they felt the defect that I had found was an anomaly.  I choose the later option.  My bag arrived promptly, and I've had several days to use it now.

I still affirm that the bag is cute, and the laptop compartment is nicely padded.  Now that I've had a 2nd try, it is more functional than I thought before.  I like that it stands up on it's own without needing a wall or leg to lean on when you set it down.  The weather has become much colder so I haven't felt if the straps are doing less damage on my shoulders than they did before.  The bag holds a little less than the bag that I am replacing, but I'm replacing that bag because it put too much strain on my neck.  This bag does not have that issue, and that may be in part because I can't put as much junk in it.  However, it has been able to hold my computer, a change of gym clothes, makeup, and sneakers when needed.

The cons are the front pockets and (still) the zippers.  Not only did the front zippers break on the first bag, but on the 2nd bag, one of the main compartment zipper popped open once.  It was the first time I was closing the bag with something in it (not much stuff either), and it split.  However, unlike with the first bag, I was able to back the zipper up, and rezip it normally.  Since then I have put a LOT more stuff in the bag, and not had the zipper issue . . . however, now that I know the zippers are on the risky side, I am VERY careful to open and close them slowly.  Not sure if they'll last forever.  The front pockets are very tight, and tricky to get things in and out of.  I think they have to be like that in order to keep the nice structured shape, but I wouldn't count on being able to put a ton in there.

So basically, I add a star to prompt & courteous customer service, and another start for the effectiveness of the 2nd bag (though I'm careful with those zippers).  One other item . . . for those that are obsessed with buying American made products - this isn't one of them.  The tags on the bags are in an asian language, and when customer service contacted me, they were definitely using something like Google Translator - it made for some charming misuses of language.  But like I said, they were very courteous, and, most importantly, they seem to care a lot about their product.  It wouldn't surprise me at all if, after reading this review, they find a way to strengthen the zippers for future bags.

******************************************************************************
I give this bag 2 stars because it is cute, & someone may not care that much about functionality. The laptop compartment is nicely padded. But that's it for pros. It's on its maiden voyage with me now, & the 2 front zippers are already broken, the straps are made of something that feels like sandpaper (my neck looks like it has raspberries on it), and it has zero ergonomic factor...by neck is killing me. I had hoped that this would double as a gym bag, but there is very little room in it. I have a couple of books, a computer & my computer charger in it now, and I wouldn't dare try to fit more in. This will definitely be returned as soon as I get home. Very disappointed.

You should know this is NOT natural jadeite or nephrite, which are the only two stones considered to be real jade. It may be nephrite/jadeite, but it is not "natural" in that it has been dyed. There are several other kinds of stone marketed as jade, but are not technically jade. My best guess is that it is aventurine stone that has been dyed and/or treated to be a more vibrant green. True jade is almost never this vibrant and uniform. If you were to find REAL natural jade this color and appearance, it would cost many thousands of dollars. It is so rare that nobody would sell it for this cheep. That being considered, it's still beautiful and inexpensive, so I bought a pair anyway, and they look great!

reviewText:
Judging by the appearance this is a stylish and on trend purse. The leather is heavy and the interior is quite lovely. The colors and style are very designer inspired and very luxurious.

Unfortunately, the quality of the purse does not match what meet the eye.

I am a Chanel lover and owner of 2 Chanel purses. I purchased this bag to supplement my Chanel collection because I love the color,  style and design. I love a good deal and this purse made me happy.

I carried it three times the first month, and on the second use, noticed the clasp began getting loose. By the third use the fourth week, both screws began coming loose and the whole clasp came off, leaving my bag and bag contents exposed.

I reached out to Ainifeel Customer Service, who promised me in three different emails, beginning in December 2017 they would  stand by their product and send me a new clasp to replace the broken one.  I followed up each time. I still don't have the needed part to securely close my Ainifeel bag.

Without the clasp, the bag is unusable and sadly must go in the trash since no replacement parts have been made available to me. Who wants to rock a purse that won't even close?

 I scored the purse one star, because even at a $110 price point, the bag should hold up for longer than three wears. Furthermore,  I wish customer service would have been more responsive and followed through with their promise to send a replacement part.
summary: Purse, looks beautiful, but fell apart after a month of  occasional use

This is a tuxedo set, that comes in 2 pieces. The top is a long sleeved white shirt with an attached tie. The tuxedo part is only in the front of the shirt - the back of the shirt is all white. The bottom piece is pin-striped tuxedo pants.

The top of the outfit is very cute, and the tuxedo vest part has a pinstripe design, as well as buttons and 2 'look-alike' pockets. The pockets are just for looks, they can't really be used, as its sewn shut. The buttons are cute, but look kind of tacky in my opinion. I would have liked to see buttons that are not quite so cheap looking. The tie that is attached to the shirt is also slightly misaligned, so it lays just a little to the side instead of right down the middle of the shirt. I don't think that it is noticeable unless you would be holding the baby, itself. Any further and it will look just fine!

The pants have to be my favorite part of the outfit. They actually have real pockets, so the baby can carry his favorite toy car, or maybe a binky when you leave the house. The top of the pants are stretchy, so if you have a baby that is a little chunky (which, they all seem to be, :-) ) the pants will stretch and not fit tight on baby.

The pinstripes are all lined up straight, and the material in the outfit is super soft and comfy!

Over all, this is a great outfit for baby to wear for a birthday party, holiday get-together, or nice outing! It is also a great gift for a baby shower, or baby's birthday! It certainly would be a hit!

I did receive this outfit for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review!
summary: Cute tuxedo outfit that is perfect for outings and celebrations!

reviewText: This little outfit is just to cute. I got this outfit for my youngest. We are huge Dr. Who fans, so it's time for the baby to dress for comiccon and even be a baby time lord for Halloween. I really like how soft the fabric is. Sometimes you can get expensive dress clothes for kiddos and they are stiff and scratchy, making for cranky and very unhappy little guys. My little guy actually is happy when he has this outfit on. The material is also light and breathable. The waist gets a thumbs up from me! If you have a skinny kiddo the elastic holds their little bellies and the pants stay just as they should. Same for babies with bigger tummies. The elastic isn't a overly tight band, which in my opinion adds to your kiddos comfort. I found the stitching and little details from the velvet tie to the buttons, and even little false pockets were done very well. This would be a perfect outfit for any special occasion or pictures as well. * I did receive this outfit at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion. It is so cute that it looks like a very formal outfit but can be used in an upscale casual dress. my son is 2 and his always with older than his age and people always overlook him and think of him as an old her child. When he was wearing this outfit, he got more compliments then never on how adorable and handsome he looked. I absolutely love the quality of the material. It's going really well and even the little guy that's on there is a text so you don't have to worry about missing accessories that complete the outfit. It's probably my favorite outfit I've ever put on my son. It's really posh and definitely on trend. And even though it is long sleeve, it's got a nicer t-shirt type material for the long sleeve that's pretty thin so you can still wear it in warmer months. My friend asked to wear it all the time. It's not only my favorite but his as well. One thing I will mention is about sizing. He's a larger 2 year old so he wears between a 3 and a 4 in most cases. I got him a size 4 because I wasn't sure on sizing. It actually was a little bit big for him but not as big as I expected it to be. My recommendation would be to buy one size up like I did and I'm really glad I did because he should be able to wear it for quite a while. summary: My new favorite for my son

reviewText: Two stars for being cute and soft fabric. But the sewing is horrible, and I'm not even picky. I took off stars because the buttons are hot glued onto the red tie, and there were strings of dried glue all over the tie because of it. If you hold up the pants to the light, the back and front seams are loosely sewn together and you can see daylight from the gaps in the seam. I could even see my son's diaper pattern through the holes in the seam when he put these pants on. There are no care instructions on the shirt or pants, so I have no idea how to wash these but I'm guessing I don't - this seems like a one time outfit, to wear once and not wash or it will fall apart. The "idgirl" tag sewn onto the hem of the shirt was sewn on hastily and crooked, and I had to cut it off because it stuck out from under the shirt. The tie is loosely sewn on to the shirt, and I was able to use just my fingers to pull it off (which I had to do, to fully remove the glue strings). The shirt actually works better without the tie. For the price, all of this is to be expected, but the quality is so low I wouldn't use this for a formal event like a wedding. It's more suited to a quick Easter egg hunt or an hour long visit with family. I ordered the size 4T, and the small size label inside the shirt read "XL".
summary: Sewing is bad, but fabric is soft at least

reviewText: Very cute bag...love the color, texture and very roomy inside.  But I don't like the zipper...it doesn't extend the length of the bag; it is a couple inches from the end of the bag (on both sides). Also, the original strap on the bag only has a 6 - 6 1/2 strap drop...I can't put it on my shoulder...although it does come with the other strap that has a much longer adjustable length strap drop; I didn't want to use it...I wanted to use to original one.  Will be returning.

You get what you pay for.  In general its not a bad handbag, its just not all that comfortable and its noisy.  Noisy because of the nylon material  used in the interior of the bag; its loud when you reach in to get your wallet or whatever you're getting.  The handles are about an inch too short to be able to sling it onto your shoulder without using the long attachable strap.  The zipper is a PITA because at the end it's not sewn down or attached to anything for about 5 inches.  When you open the bag then want to re-zip it the zipper twists itself over and under so you can't zip it without pulling the 5 inch piece out then twisting it back to its original and right shape.  The canvas itself is of good quality.  I'll make some personal alterations such as remove the big rings on the sides and fix the zipper situation somehow.  I'm hoping the hard nylon material will soften up and be less noisy with wear.
summary: Everything comes out a bit short...

NOT real leather, this PU leather bag is a great imitation. If you are one of those who likes to carry the kitchen drawer in her bag then this may well be a great bag for you! VERY versatile in that you can use it as a shoulder bag OR carry it using the two shorter handles. BOTH the shoulder strap and the carrying handles are easily removable if you only want to use one or the other. The carrying handles unpop and the shoulder strap unclips.

There is a zipped pocket on the outside and then on the inside, which is lined you will find more pockets plus you will see that it is divided into two sections. One large zip closes the entire inside keeping all your belongings safe.

Overall measurements are approximately 16" wide x 12 1/4" high x 4" deep.

I hope the "fishy" smell will dissipate after a few days of fresh air. The bag comes sealed pretty well in two bags so this is likely its first chance to "breathe"! As I said at the beginning, if you are a big bag kind of person, then you will like this one. Product provided in exchange for an honest review. Thanks, Liz

reviewText: SLEEVE LENGTH SHORT AND WIDTH NARROW - MORE OF A JUNIORS SMALL.

I could probably save time by just copying 'Radiantwild's review exactly, which I wish I had seen before purchasing.  First off, size.  "Too small" is an understatement.  The title clearly says "Women's" sizing.  My 5'0" 95-pound, thin, athletic daughter wears their size XL so let that be a guide.  Second is the quality.  I actually ordered 3 sweaters at the same time (same style, same color) and every single one of them is a different quality, different material, and different fabric?!?  Even the cuffs are different.  2 were just the thin (VERY THIN) material folded over and 1 has a ribbed material for the cuff.  The fabric is so thin if you're wearing a T-shirt with words on it underneath you'd have no problem reading it.  1 sweater had about 10 unfinished seams and threads hanging everywhere.  The other two just had very poorly sewn seams.  To be honest, when I opened the package it looked like a elementary school home ec project gone terribly wrong.  The item is shipped from China so you can't return it.  I was offered $3.50 for a refund, and to keep the item.  So I'm out about $45 (for three) and have a wad of fabric I can't imagine using for any other purpose.  You get what you pay for.  Lesson learned.
summary: when I opened the package it looked like a elementary school home ec project gone terribly wrong

reviewText: Product as described. I didn't stop to think about wrinkle factor

As a result of drug induced hair loss when I was 17, I have been covering my hair for a number of years. I generally will wear scarves, hats, and wide headbands to cover the bald and thin spots at the front and sides of my head. This is the first time I have tried a pre-tied scarf and was eager to see how it compared to a regular scarf. First off, it comes wrapped in tissue paper with a nice little bow on it, so it can easily be given as a gift as-is. Second, the material is soft and the royal blue chiffon is a beautiful, vivid color. I have a pair of pants the exact same color that go perfectly with it. The tie in the back is actually an elastic piece that holds its shape and allows it to stretch. There is also another tie on the back that I believe is supposed to be for getting a custom fit.
Unfortunately, I found a couple of things that I thought were bothersome. The scarf is basically a one size fit all, but I found that it was a little too large for my head and even with the tie on the back, it is really hard to get a custom fit because where the elastic is situated. Also, even with hair, the scarf shifted and slid around on my head as I was going about my day and I had to keep adjusting it. I know that this could be easily remedied by purchasing a wig or scarf gripper which is basically a headband that prevents that issue, but I don't have one at the moment.
I do like the scarf. I like the color of it, the material, the fact that I can just throw it on in a hurry, but I think that overall, a regular scarf is easier to customize. It can be tied to your head as tight as you want, but a wig gripper may do the trick as well. I guess it is a matter of personal preference.

I received this scarf at a discount for an honest review. My opinions are my own.

I am currently receiving chemo therapy and in the process of loosibg my hair. I was diagnosed with stage two hormone receptive breast cancer at the age of 31.

This product has worked great for me. It is light and airy. It has elastic in the back ant two small pieces of fabric in the back. It is made with cotton and keeps your head cool. I ordered it in blue. It is a beautiful color.

If you have a tingly or sensitive scalp, like some people do when they start loosing their hair, you may find tgis headcover not as silky as other ones from headcovers unlimited. But of is Much cooler than the rayon based fabrics and better for summer. If you do find your scalp to be sensitive as you begin to loose your hair, youcan rub some hand cream with aloe vera or vitamin e on your hand and then lightly on to your scalp to reduce sensitivity.

This is a great scarf and aI have already recommended it to some of my friends in my cancer support froup. I did receive this product at a reduced price in exchange for my honest review.

I got this for my mom and she loves it!. Super lightweight and flowy, so it doesn't make your head hot and sweaty, which my mom said could be a big problem. She actually feels "dressy" in it and not frumpy. It;s good to be able to keep some femininity while wearing a scarf. She really loves it. I am very very happy with my purchase! Super easy to put on and use. I definitely recommend!!
I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest unbiased review. I am not obligated to give a positive review nor would I if unless I believed it was. I'm posting my opinion to help fellow customers make their decision when they are shopping here on amazon. The discount did not sway my opinion whatsoever. Thank you for reading!!

reviewText:
I love, love, love this grip band! I have a variety of wigs, from full cap wigs to half wigs. The half wigs fit just fine but I can have some sizing issues with the full cap wigs from time to time and the clips aren't always the best. This is very comfortable and helps to give my faux hair a more natural look. This is a great addition for anyone who wears wigs. I wear wigs every now and then to change my look but they can get very uncomfortable throughout the day, especially with the clips digging into my scalp. This is a great change of pace and I will highly recommend this to my fellow wig wearers including some of my family and friends.

I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. Good or bad, my reviews are based on my personal experience with the product.

Grip Band - Holds Head Scarves, Wigs, Hats and Headwear in Place - Scarf Grip, Wig Gripper - Brown G This works perfectly to keep any head cover in place comfortably and without extra bulk. I have bought at least 4 other brands and this one is the flattest one I have found. My only complaint is that they did not come up with this solution 20 years ago!

I wear scarves a lot, but I hate when they go sliding off my head and I have to keep readjusting it. This grip band was recommended to me by a friend, and I was thrilled to try it out!
It is made of a crushed velvet like fabric, and once I out it on it didn't budge no matter how much I pulled and tugged my scarf. It even stayed on when I scratched my head.
The only issue I can see myself ever having is the thickness of the fabric. The fabric is quite thin, and I'm hoping it will hold up well despite this.
I can see this product being really useful on a windy day. Just put it on under your scarf or wig and you won't have to worry about it flying off!

The grip band is very comfortable.  It really holds my wig in place. I wear my wig the whole day and the band holds the wig in place very well.  It works better than a nylon hair cover.  I would recommend this to others.

reviewText: I purchased this grip band because it was recommended to me by a dear friend that wore one due to hair loss. I wear wigs sometimes to help enhance my appearance as I too have thinning hair. I have always felt a sense of discomfort around the edge of my hair  as the wig irritates my skin upon contact. The band wraps around my hair very comfortably and holds in place with a loop fastener. I have hair so i was a bit concerned about bulkiness around the front of my head. The fitting of the band is amazing, you can not even tell i have it on. This means I can revert back to my wig collection as I deterred from it due to the discomfort. I was looking into purchasing more for breast cancer month as I think this is a great gift. I like to give away practical gifts, something people will use and I believe this is it! I purchased this grip band at a discounted rate, and am so in love with it I plan to purchase more for future gifts.

This is a great way to keep your scarf or wig in place! In my case, I cover my hair with scarves. The material is great for holding on to scarves and keeping them from slipping off my head. I like that it has the velcro on the back so you can adjust it. I have normal headbands that I have tried, and they are usually elastic and too tight. The band is also nice and thin so you can't see it through my scarves. The color (beige) that I received is also really nice under light colored scarves. Very happy with this purchase!

reviewText:
I like this shirt a lot. I'm female, 5'4" around 138-ish lbs and I purchased a men's small. It fits just fine, like many other of my men's small 'design/logo' type shirts. I know they have women's styles, but it's like it's next to impossible for them to make a women's cut in the same designs as the guy's stuff. Sometimes I like the designs on the men's shirts better.
This shirt is definitely for a person with a long(er) torso (or perhaps taller than I); the shirt comes down to about mid-thigh on me, where as other brands/styles of Men's shirts fall at my hip. And I do/can roll the sleeve up, but that pretty common for me with men's tees.
The shirt is pretty soft and does not appear to shrink much after the wash; which is great (but, personally, this time I was kind of hoping it would, just to fit a little shorter on me). The silk screen has held up nicely after three washes (though I wash it cold, inside out on light or medium settings). Though I cannot vouch for the dryer setting, as the dial is broken so it only has one setting-- on; which works well enough for me for now- as long as it dries the clothes. I do not have space to hang my clothes to dry somewhere.

The only real complaint about this shirt is that the tan "F8" logo is a bit sticky. Now it does not make your fingers sticky and it does not stick to itself after the wash; but you can feel it. I don't really know how else to describe it. I don't think I really would have noticed it much, but I had the shirt on while I was watching my nephew. And since he is only 13m, he notices everything and he just couldn't stop touching the "F8" logo; it was like his entertainment for the day. He was glued to my hip or on my lap most of the day because all he wanted to do was keep touching the logo. I actually found it a bit funny (and bit tiring because he weighs well over 25 lbs and is three feet tall, so he's pretty awkward to hold for long periods of time).
summary: A men's small is nice for women

I hate giving 2-stars or fewer, but in this case I had to - because the name of the item is complete rubbish, misleading and incorrect.  There may be no RAISED seams on the OUTSIDE of these tights/compression pants, but there are very clear, defined and scratchy seams on the inside - in the crotch and down the entire leg.  I was SUPER disappointed, especially given the title, because I bought these for my nephew, who struggles with sensory overload issues... in order to get him to wear most any pants, he has to wear tights, leggings or similar bottoms under jeans, etc. because the seams irritate him to the point that he's crying, screaming and throwing the pants on the ground.  Obviously these did not work.

To be fair to the brand, the quality seemed great - fabric, fit, cut, etc... all good.  But they are NOT "seamless" by any means, and that was both a bummer and source of major annoyance, since I had to repack them, make a trip to the post and send them back.

I really love this fascinator, definite glamour you can work in to many occasions, not just for the most formal. With a sturdy comb mount, you can place it at my points in your front, back and side. I would recommend adding a few bobby pins or gator clips to steady it, especially if you are not used to placing them. This is easy to wear but your confidence goes up when you know your hairstyle and accessories don't need to be checked continually. Sometimes I wear things around the house to give things a test run, practical but fun. If you have a long and/or a lot of hair, this will look somewhat smaller on you and will be more bold on someone with shorter or finer hair. I have very long thick hair that I rolled up for the pictures.

Pros:

~  Well made
~ Lightweight for easy wear
~ Versatile style that can be semi casual to formal

Cons:

~  A small box or pouch to store this in, to protect it and make it feel special, would really add to it's charm

Overall, this is a lovely piece that will lend itself to many occasions and make the lady wearing it stand out over many years.

I received a discounted sample for evaluation to allow me to offer you my thoughts and opinions. Real life use and POV descriptions from other customers are important to me and often what helps me make my choice.  I hope this helps you.

I love this hair flower comb! It arrived super fluffy and protected, still carrying its shape well. However, if the mail does bend the flower a bit, there are instructions included in how to fluff it up again. It's a big flower with lots of fun little dangles coming off of it. It's attached to a black comb that you can tuck into your hair. It looks great with your hair up or down, and it's really easy to dress up something you're wearing. It stays in your hair well, and the flower is not heavy, so it feels effortless on your head. Love it! I'm all about hats and hair accessories!

If you found this review or any of my other reviews interesting or helpful, please rate is as "helpful" or leave a comment. I enjoy writing reviews on products that I love and hearing feedback, since I base many of my personal purchases off of the reviews of others as well. I also feel that honest and helpful reviews provide insight to the company. I received this product at a discount in a promotion, and this is my honest and unbiased review. I am not connected to this company or any of the companies of products that I review.

This gorgeous little floral fascinator looks just like the photo and arrived in perfect condition. I LOVE all the whispy little feathers.  I have red hair and bought this to go with a little black cape that has marabou trim and they look absolutely smashing together.  The flower is held in place with a comb. I put my hair in a French twist and the comb held the flower in place perfectly even when shaking my head or leaning over.  I have bought a lot of little vintage fascinators over the years to go with my collection of vintage clothes and at retail this one is pretty much in line with what I have paid for most of them.  It's great to find a modern source of hats to compliment a vintage wardrobe without having to spend ages scouring vintage clothing shops and thrift stores looking for them.

The folks at Lovful were kind enough to provide me with these leggings in exchange for sharing my unbiased review...

First off, these leggings are thicker and warmer than any of my fleece lined or other leggings I own.

For reference, I typically wear a women's size 6, I'm curvy and pear shaped. According to the sizing info in the product description, these fit my 38" hips but realistically, these are not a comfortable fit because they are too tight.

These are listed to be seamless on the packaging but they are not (see photo). The way these are cut, I wouldn't wear them like regular leggings or pants that are okay to bend over in... Because of their cut, like pantyhose, they'd look silly. So they're thick like pants but cut like your booty should definitely not be seen.

These are super soft, inside and out and they do stretch but I'd recommend them for a US size 4 or smaller (or a size 6 if you don't have wide hips).

I rated these 3 stars because although they appear to be well made and there are no loose seams, I don't think the pantyhose like cut is appropriate for a fur-lined winter wear type product.

I think their look is pretty. Only when you put them on can you see they're really shimmery. I gave these as a gift to my teenage niece who loves everything bright and fun. As an adult, I wouldn't wear these.

Would recommend to others for quality but only considering the above because, of course, it depends on your preferences! I will update this review later down the road should these not hold up well for my niece.

We've had them for a little over two months without any problems. Adding some photos so you can get a closer look. Smile. Hope this is helpful!
summary: Super Warm And Soft But Cut Like Pantyhose.......... See Photos~

My ONE issue with this shirt is that the pink floral overlay is split in the back. If you have an ample rear area, the split becomes wider, making it appear that you are stretching the shirt to capacity, when of course, you aren't because it's a stretchy shirt. I bought a 2X and it fits perfectly - a 3X would have been too big  in the arms and chest areas. I like this Allegra item and would probably buy more of their shirts, but I HOPE they consider the design flaw of this very pretty shirt.  By the way, I washed it in cold water and hung it to dry on a padded hanger (to avoid what my daughter calls "shoulder nipples" in the shirt) and it dried over night.

reviewText: I had my eye on the gold version of this dress earlier in the year for a holiday party with an Oscar gala sort of theme. Life got busy, and I forgot to order it until sometime around mid-November. I was worried it wouldn't make it to me on time, so I contacted the seller. Belle House was very accomodating, and promised a close eye would be kept on the shipping so it would arrive in time for my event. It did arrive in time without a hitch. The dress is absolutely gorgeous. Complete strangers not even attending my event approached me to tell me how beautiful I looked. I'm certain I have never received so many compliments in one evening. Pay close attention to the size charts, because my dress fit exactly to my measurements. Had I selected according to the size I "normally" wear, it would have been too small. Also, know this dress has serious length. I'm 5'9", and wore 3.5" heels, but still stepped on the hem when dancing. If I'd had the time, I would have had it altered. Nonetheless, it was worth the trip hazard. My event was three weeks ago, and people at my workplace are still talking about my standout attire of that evening.

I started with the iron on a low setting, no steam, and with a white pillowcase protecting the fabric until I was sure the iron was behaving right.  I gradually increased the heat and added steam, and was very happy with the results.

reviewText:
This top is going to be one of my staples this fall. The grey material is a light, whitish hue that is very similar to the photo on Amazon. The lace comes up to a few inches under the bust, leaving just enough room to accessorize with a belt to complete the look. One of the coolest features of the top is that the lace is not just around the bottom, but also comes up in triangular peaks that are also filled with a slightly different white lace. The shape of the lace peaks gives the "skirt" portion a nice flow and flounce. The lace itself is pure white and reminds me of a gorgeous wedding veil, but in shirt form. The lace has rose and other floral motifs that add even further feminine flair. I think my favorite part about this top is the actual material itself! The grey shirt is so soft and comfortable to wear. It's just heavy enough to provide some warmth, but it isn't so heavy as to feel restrictive in movement.

Pros
-Gorgeous white lace with floral motifs
-Shirt material is incredibly comfortable
-The "skirt" has nice flow as you move

Cons
-I have long arms, so the sleeves are a little shorter than I would normally look for in the "perfect" outfit, but that is just being nitty gritty picky.

I'm really happy that I was able to receive this top at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

Gorgeous dress! Beautifully made - attention to detail and nice fabric. I really wanted to love this dress, but it runs very small. I ordered according to the size chart. I am 5'7", 125#, 34A. I ordered a size 6, but I could barely zip up the dress  and I definitely couldn't breathe. The area around the rib cage is so tight and there is absolutely no stretch to the fabric. If I were to order a size up, the neckline would be too wide and gape and the skirt would be too wide. This is a heavier fabric and if the skirt is too wide, it will not lay nicely. Maybe I'm just the wrong shape for this dress but I love the Jackie O. look.

I've never been able to do any of those things without having some kind of allergic reaction to earrings. I do clean them and my ears daily with alcohol pads. I purchased these to ensure my holes do not close and I can wear these with any outfit. I do not even buy fancy earrings anymore. I wear these w/ all outfits and get compliments on how simple and cute they are. Do not opt for the 8mm ones, Get the 10mm, you won't be sorry. They are not too small, not too big, JUST RIGHT. Some insert thru the front of your ear, some your have to insert thru the back of your ear.  It is hard to twist the backs on because the screw inserts are so small.  I have previously bought a pair of this type of earrings from a specialty shop and they are wonderful.  Made out of real horn and the backs slide on to the post.  These are horrible.  I guess I got what I paid for since I paid less than half for nine pair of this than I did for my one real pair.  I would not recommend buying these

reviewText:

The problem with them is after a few months of use, the screws easily strip and won't tighten down. Sometimes they feel like theyll stay even though they are loosely screwed together but lately they fall out of my ears all day so I have quit wearing them.

I do LOVE the look of these, they draw attention and get far more compliments than I expected. Unfortunately, they're only good for one wear or so and only last about a week. They screw on and are VERY easily stripped when you have to screw them in that one last time to get them to sit flush against your ear. One twist too many and youve just got nothing to hold the post in place. Wouldnt recommend for anyone looking for something that will last.

reviewText: As an avid fan of 2 Tone Records, founded by Jerry Dammers of The Specials in Coventry, England, back in the late 1970s, and of the 2 Tone movement's message of multi-racial unity advocated by bands like The Selector, The Beat, Madness, Bad Manners, and of course The Specials, I could not resist getting this leather wallet with the embossed 2 Tone logo featuring the face of Walt Jabsco, 2 Tone's black-and-white cartoon mascot appearing on many of their record album covers.  The wallet is much nicer than expected, soft leather, dark brown exterior with red stitching, red leather interior, with a cool 2 Tone black-and-white checkered pattern lining the billfold and the ID holder.  It's got seven separate card holders (including your ID), two larger interior pockets, and a divided billfold.  A nice accessory for any ska aficionado!  And the seller, Spirit of England (Oxbloodoi), is one cool cat who goes above and beyond to make sure every order ships securely and quickly, and that the item you get is in perfect new condition.  Big thumbs up!!!

reviewText: Very comfortable and great fit. Although they do rub a bit in the groin, they fit as advertised. I am not sure I would buy more though. I think there are others out there that are equally comfortable and cheaper.

This has to be the most comfortable and supportive athletic boxer brief I've ever worn.  It fits as expected...but the adjustability feature is incredible!  It's entirely up to the wearer how snugly one want this boxer-jock to cradle his boys; and whether you want less or more lift/support, the UFM 3.0 looks absolutely great!  What's really amazing is that this undergarment can keep everything away and snug and offer a fully-functional fly--usually you get either great support or the functionality of a fly with a much less supportive pouch.  I've never before seen this seamless combination of total support and functionality...and I give this product my highest recommendation!

reviewText:
I love this carry case! I thought I was the only who called my handgun "The Lord Your God." Now, I can carry Him with me everywhere I go, without having to wear that bulky under-arm holster. The bonus is that this concealed-carry case doubles as a less-lethal weapon! With several pounds of blued steel safely tucked inside, it packs quite a wallop when I swing it by the sturdy straps. I did have to take off one star, because my piece is bigger than most, and this case is a bit too small for The Lord Your God.

For some reason, I have been getting funny locks from the other guys at the bar, and they keep making comments about a "man purse" and impugning my masculinity. But I know I have The Lord Your God with me at all times, and He is Bigger than any of them. They are just jealous that I was the first one to get this amazing concealed carry case.
summary: A bit snug for The Lord Your God

reviewText: Great product and great price.  Shipped and I had it within 3 days -- super!

I've been trying lately to be thoughtful about what I carry every day - how does it serve me, is it compact, is it durable, does it do what I need it to do?  I'm not a survival gear person. But having what I need in my handbag, without it weighing a ton, is a good thing. A wallet is something you always have with you, so it definitely needed some thought. Nancy and I have a lot in common. Always snooping around, and redheaded. So this was a great acquisition for me. It's small but well organized, charming, and well made

Nancy Drew introduced me to reading & specifically to reading mysteries. Who didn't want to be Nancy Drew?  When I first saw this wallet, I knew I had to have it.  It is so pretty & so compact but yet holds everything I need to carry. The pictures & quotes are right from the covers & stories of the series. It is durable too. I ordered a second one & was going to give it to a friend but still haven't been able to part with it.....just in case I need a replacement. (This is unlikely to happen for awhile. reviewText: Super cute! I love it

I could care less about a vegan wallet, except that it means this wallet is not leather, which I wish it was. I grew up with Nancy Drew. She taught me how to read and to love mysteries, as she did my daughter. Both of us, possibly because of Nancy Drew at an early age, love and eat mysteries. My daughter, at age 7, said to me one day after school, "Mom, I'm sick of crooks and kidnappers. I want some real murders!" So you can now imagine why we are Nancy Drew fans, and the wallet is so cool! I bought the first one for myself. In October, I'll buy a second one for my daughter's birthday. If you grew up with Nancy, this wallet is priceless.
summary: She taught me how to read and to love mysteries, as she did my daughter

reviewText:
I love the quote, and never before have I been complimented on my clothes while working out until I wore this to the gym.  It fits as expected, but I give everyone some advice: MEASURE YOURSELF!

1) Pick your favorite shirt and lay it on a flat surface
2) Use a ruler or tape measure, and measure it from the inseam beneath the arm pits, straight across to the other (double your measurement to know your size)

Once you've measured yourself, you'll be able to figure out which size tank to get.  Trust me, you need to know precisely because clothing can run smaller than they say.

This tank, however, stretches.  Maybe it's the fact that I carry a 30lb toddler around a lot and he has a tendency to stretch fabric, but my tank now goes to the center of my chest and the arm holes are rather wide.  It's still a good quality tank, but the fabric is thin so keep in mind that it will stretch over time.
summary: Measure yourself, and expect some stretching.

So warm, double thick knit. I purchased these gloves to go with a hat and vest. Very cute ensemble.

I am taking the kids up to Canada this summer on a road trip and I know that it will be summer but being the planning person I am, I checked the weather and found that it is going to be in the 40s for much of our time there. That may not be cold to some, and that's okay, but for us Floridians, it may as well be below zero. I bought these gloves thinking I could let one of my girls wear them but then my husband kindly showed me that they are for adults. Oh well, I need warm hands too and so does my mom, whom I am bringing along.

Living in FL there are very few places to buy good gloves and you can only find them for about a week in January, if you can find them at all. Amazon was my only hope and they did not disappoint.

I have small hands so I wasn't too sure how these would fit but they do fit me nicely. The fingers are a tad too long but hardly noticeable. They are very thick and warm and the cuffs can be rolled down if you prefer, to give them more length. They look just like the picture, I bought the yellow ones, and are comfortable without limiting my dexterity greatly.

Just one more thing to check off my list! I was able to receive these at a discount in return for my review.
summary: Very warm but a tad long on my fingers

reviewText:
Are you one of the many with earlobes that, after all that progress, are dying to be seen, publicly, in their full, stretched, unadulterated glory? Allow these stone plugs to be of assistance, and you'll be flashing everyone in no time. Read on for further details.

These plugs are just a touch longer than I expected them to be, as was previously suggested by some of the other reviewers, but it doesn't bother me. They look and feel so nice! The finish gives them such a nice gloss that they flash a glare as you move, under the right lighting conditions, unlike the black, plastic plugs I had in before. I, honestly, didn't think it would make that much of a difference, appearance wise, but it does. You really can see a difference, just in the way that they shine. The plastic ones don't look the same. The edges are so soft, smooth, and rounded, which makes them much easier to put in.

FYI, I'm new to 0g (I was at 2g forever!), and I've never tried these stone plugs before. There are very few options if you're not, at least, at 0. Additionally, there really was no point in trying to stock up on jewelry that would soon be too small. I figured I should just wait if I planned on eventually getting to 0g anyway. Anyhow, the flared edge was a bit of a pain to push through at first, but once it was in, it actually felt good. Kind of like, for any one that lifts weights, when you push a muscle really hard, the way it feels when the blood rushes through it once you've stopped, and it doesn't hurt anymore. I don't know... maybe I'm just weird. Lol. Needless to say, they are probably not going to fall out, as the edge is just wide enough to hurt. Wow, the end of that last sentence sounded quite provocative... but I digress.

Anyhow, I definitely recommend these. No sizing issues for me with these ones. They're just right. Excellent quality and at a fantastic price. Can't beat that. I love them, and I'm very happy with my purchase. Thanks, Mystic Metals!
These are awesome! Perfect condition; smooth, no rough or jagged edges; sizing is perfect; shipped on time. Love them!

reviewText: perfect

I bought a FlexFit cap a couple of years ago and wanted to get another of the exact same in a different color. But here's the problem... the cap doesn't have any model number or any identification on it. This is flat-out stupid when you consider that FlexFit makes so many different versions of ball caps. How the heck am I supposed to figure out what model I have so that I can get another? Very annoying.

Aside from this being the wrong one, it was also noticeably and unacceptably larger than the one I have... even though they are listed as the exact same size. Lastly, even though I knew this to be the case before I bought it, the light grey underside of the bill doesn't make sense to me. I'd rather it match the color of the hat, for one thing, but apart from that it doesn't make sense because the lighter color reflects more light into your eyes. That kinda goes against the point of wearing this! If the hat had otherwise been what I wanted, this wouldn't have been a deal-killer... but it's worth mentioning to others as a head's-up.

Also, FYI, this thing has a higher profile than you might think from the photo and description. It's listed as "mid pro," but to me it seems more like high profile.

Three stars due to the inconsistent sizing, light-color underside, and FlexFit not including model numbers in their hats.
summary: FlexFit needs improvement in a few ways

reviewText:
I purchased the black sweater, size L. I normally wear a US 4-6 but purchased a larger size because I was worried about it shrinking or the arms being too short. That wasn't an issue, a small or medium might have been fine (I like sweaters a bit larger). I now need to do some seamstress magic to make it smaller. That isn't too much an issue since the seams aren't 'finished' like many sweaters. They seems to have a rough edge (not folded over) with some stitching to prevent unraveling.

I wish the fabric had more...something. I feel like when I put that on I can't see anything but a big, black sweater. The cross-over front blends in, like I'm wearing a tunic (maybe because it's too large?).

I've seen the cute Pinterest pics of identical sweaters but in different colors; I thought the black would be more of a charcoal like I've seen but this is a jet black fabric and it all just blends in together.
summary: Go by the sizing chart they've posted in the product description.

We were delightfully surprised with this purchase! My husband misplaced his original wedding band (tungsten carbide) and chances are he'll continue to misplace them, so we wanted to find another inexpensive option for him.

The ring is very appealing, aesthetically, and it is surprisingly light! (We were worried it would look cheap or too "fakey" with the woodgrain.) He likes this one better than the original one we got for him!

He's worn it for a while now, and it's still looking good. Considering he works in food service and is big into the outdoors (fishing, hunting, camping and the like), I am surprised that the varnish and everything is still holding up well. All in all, a wonderful purchase!

I've included photos of the dress on myself and on a dress form set to the measurements for the 2XL.

The fabric on the dress is on the thicker side, so if you are going to be somewhere warm, this might be a better pick for cooler weather.

The dress is well-made, though I  would have preferred to see an invisible zipper in the back.  It comes in a small garment style bag and is well-protected.

The plus-size is accurate for what I was expecting, and actually turned out much better than many other dresses I have ordered online.

This dress is well made and very cute. I'm a size 16 and I purchased an XXL. It fits a little saggy, I should have gone down a size but I am used to things purchased online being too small. Not the case with this one. The material is very stretchy so I think it would be safe to buy a smaller size if you'd like a more flattering fit. I think this dress would be flattering on any figure. I like the material, it's very comfortable. The shape is very versatile and looks good with or without a belt, also looks nice under a cardigan. If you want more fluff in the skirt, a petticoat will do the job. There is enough material in the skirt to make it flow nicely. Fun to twirl around in. The back zipper is very sturdy and the stitching seems sturdy as well. I received this at a discount in exchange for an unbiased review.

My favorite feature is probably all of the pockets, theres so many! and I like how most of them snap closed too, so nothing falls out. The hood is removable as well. reviewText:
I wanted to wait to write this review to give fjackets a chance to respond to my concerns.

The Pros: It is a kind of nice vest and well made even if it is a slight bit tight. I love vests and have about 10 different ones that I wear all the time and the XL fits just right with just a touch of belly room. This vest leaves no room so I would recommend going up on size if you plan on leaving it zipped while eating.

The Cons: 1. If you are looking for an exact replica of Chris Pratts vest, this is not it. The most obvious change is the height of the zipper compared to the pockets. But there are about 6 discrepancies I found.
  2. Pockets are for decoration only as they are too small for anything other than a pack of gum
  3. You can get the exact same vest for cheaper from Jacket Fans and save yourself $57.00.
  4. When I called this to the attention of Fjackets, I was promptly (they responded to my email very quickly) told they would refund the difference between their vest and the one sold by other company however that was on May 11, 2016. I was very impressed with their response, however it is now July 3rd and the refund still hasn't happened so I will give fjackes a ONE star and the vest a 3 star.
summary: It is a kind of nice vest and well made even if it is a ...

Let's break this down bit by bit. You get what you pay for. It's cotton, which is cheaper than synthetics or wool, bit you loose certain features such as warmth if you get wet (from snow, rain, or sweat).

It fit is VERY small. You want thermals to fit close, but not this close. It'll probably be unwearable once it is washed. Also the slaves are really short. I wear between a 33 and a 34 inch on my dress shirts & the arms on the large size hit about where I would wear a watch. Meh. I generally prefer a longer sleave, but it keeps them out of sight.

The length of the shirt is nice though. I prefer a two piece thermal & this hasn't come untucked on me yet.

The material is very thin. Again, not a bad thing if the material & weave make up for it. But this fails to trap air & keep it warm against your body.  Perhaps if you order a size or two larger, it'll do a little better, but because it runs so small, the material is stretched tight.

Conclusion - if you want a little something extra in cool (not cold) temps, this is ok for the price. But my suggestion is to save your money & invest in a much higher quality set of thermals.
summary: small, thin, & a poor weave - but cheap

reviewText: Awesome T shirt

I had the previous version of this SCOTTeVEST microfleece hoodie and I wasn't all that impressed with it.  This one honestly isn't that much better.  I like the idea of a lot of pockets but when you start filling those pockets, you realize that it's too much of a good thing.  I would feel a bit better about this hoodie if it were $65 instead of $85.  The material is soft and comfortable but the chest pockets are so cheap and flimsy.

I'm a woman but I do not like tight fitting clothing or things "riding up" as so often women's tops do so I opted for the men's version.  I couldn't remember if the last hoodie I ordered shrunk a bit so I got a larger size just in case.  The fit is very very loose and I hope that it does shrink after a few times in the wash.

The exterior pockets are really nice.  I can quickly tuck items away in the top pockets or put hand warmers in if I choose.  I photograph football games so I do expect to use them has handwarmer pockets.  The older hoodie had a springy key holder in it, which is now gone in favor of some bungy thing that i will not use.  The hidden pocket is really cool and I guess you could use it to tuck a cash or if you're a spy, an SD card in.  There are also thumbholes on the cuffs.  I've never really gotten the point of these but my friend squealed with pleasure when she realized they had them.

The interior chest pockets is where we get dicey.  They're made of a very thin nylon.  One of mine was torn when I received it in the mail.  I wanted to wear it immediately so I sewed it up myself rather than return it.  It was in doing so that I noticed that the pockets on this new version had gone from being well thought out compartments to just being big clumsy openings.  If you put a multitool in one of the pockets and move around as I do, it just tumbles around, eventually making it's way back to the deeper portion of the pocket.  In fact, anything that you put in that pocket will just slide around instead of staying in it's place and mostly ends up weighing the jacket down.  Another negative is that all of the pockets are pretty loose and open.  There are magnetic closures that are a nice feature but nothing I feel is really secure.  Maybe this is supposed to make it more

The one positive about the interior is that I am glad that they got rid of the plastic ID pocket, which I destroyed on the original after I put it in the dryer by accident.  Also, the weird personal area network flaps are gone in favor of small elastic loops.

I've made some modifications by sewing sections into the interior pockets to this to make it work for me and the things I need to hold.  The SCOTTeVEST is a great idea, but I feel like Scott may need to do a few more revisions to make this perfect.
summary: Second SCOTTeVEST, second 'Meh' vote from me

reviewText:
I like the idea of having many pockets since there are many things to carry nowadays.
Okay, the product description says this hoodie has 10 pockets but I found 9...  two each of inner chest pockets ( actually one big pocket with a divider), one each of top loading pocket, one each of side pocket ( top loading pocket divide this pocket ), small coin pocket inside left side pocket.
There is supposed to be a secret pocket inside right pocket but I couldn't locate it.
And iPad/iPad mini will not fit in any of pockets, at least on size M version. I suppose size X-Large has bigger pockets.
It is a well balanced hoodie but I think it is overpriced.

It is quite warm, but don't buy it for the pockets. The fit is small, and the pockets on this style aren't that abundant. The jacket is a very close fit, but only one pocket will take an iPhone plus, and that is right by your left jaw, and the shape protrudes. It is good for layering, but don't bother buying it thinking you will get heaps of pockets. If you do stuff your pockets you will look incredibly lumpy, and everyone will know that you have items stowed. I generally don't wear mine as the cut is short as well (I'm 6'1").  I wish it had bigger pockets, was looser, and was longer. But it has none of these.

I was in need of a hoodie with multiple pockets that fit comfortably, and this absolutely did the trick. Now that winter is here, I find myself taking it to the gym with me. Love, love, love this hoodie.
summary: ... need of a hoodie with multiple pockets that fit comfortably, and this absolutely did the trick

In no way was this worth $25. $15 at the most.  And yes I got authentic "bepei"

Pros
Great color saturation. I got the green. Think rich yet dark. Real nice.

The cut is heaven. I'm 5foot6 and wear a 16. I got the XXL and it was definitely the right size for me.  it stops at the bottom of my butt. Perfect fit and flare. Very comfy. The feel of being in PJ's yet you look cute.

Cons
Material is thin. Not like a sweatshirt. More like a regular stretchy soft cotton. Almost jersey knit. I'm a curvy girl and its not very forgiving (mine isn't tight at all but when it got cold it was easy to tell by looking at my chest if you know what i mean.).

There were 3 stitching defects I see immediately.  The pouch isn't sewn on all the way. The cuff stitching missed the fabric in a spot and there's something funky on the hood I can't quite figure out.

The draw strings are coming unraveled already I tied them to try to stop it.

The neck line is sewn weird on the inside but this time on purpose.  I can't explain but if you buy one youll see what I mean immediately.  It kinda makes you say "huh?"

Basically I think this price point is way off.  To say an original price of $45!?!?  That'd be robbing someone to be frank.. $25 is still too high for what you're getting.. at. $10 - $15 I'd fix the holes by sewing myself and never mention it - heck I would probably get another one at that point. But no way at $25.

Ok, so I ordered 4 pairs of leggings from 3 different china shops. This pair was one of two that I was pretty pleased with. I own a few real Black Milk leggings so I was curious to compare with these ones. Both in price and there are discontinued styles on Amazon. Here are few things to consider about THESE leggings.
-Firstly these are XS-S size. I wear Black milk Large which according their website is Waist-89  Hip-114.5cm, from the description of these I should fit, right? Nope, not even close. So I gave them to my little sister who fits into them beautifully.
-The print on them was the right one, but instead of looking like it was painted within thin stokes, it looks like it was a watercolor painting. With this print though it totally doesn't look funky. Like BM could have made them look like that and it would still sell. I think only someone who owns an authentic pair in this style would notice they are knockoffs.
-The material is thick, not like BM's, but not see through if they fit well. Other people have said these leggings have broken, the pair I received was well stitched and besides the thinner fabric do not see them ripping any sooner then I would expect my Black Milk pairs to rip

If they were true to size and would fit me I would order tons of pairs from this retailer. I would recommend buying one just to see how they work for you. After all, they are knock-offs using the picture of the real thing so you can never be too sure what you will receive. (2 out of 4 of the leggings I got are atrocious! They were not from THIS retailer but be careful)
summary: Decent leggings, The best of what you could hope for the price

reviewText: This purse turned out great!  I was a bit worried about quality and if it would look cheap when it arrived.  I used this purse all winter before I switched to a summer color, and I will probably return to this same purse in the fall.

I received the last of the black bags today. It's a cute, light weight bag that looks small because of the shape, but easily holds a lot of items. Here are the pros and cons:
Pros:
-Small strap is long enough to slide bag all the way up to top of arm
-Has an additional adjustable, detachable long strap, making it very versatile
-It's lightweight, small/medium size in appearance, but has a surprising large interior capacity
-Cell phone (s7) fits easily in the outside zippered compartment
-It's a cool shape and perfect for everyday use

Cons:
-It does not feel like real leather and there's no indication on the bag (nor a claim by the manufacturer that it is)
- The interior lacks structure. The middle zippered compartment slumps over regardless of what it inside and covers the contents of adjacent interior compartments
- The main zipper requires two hands to close  (you have to hold an end with one hand and pull the zipper with the other)

In my opinion, the bag that I received is not worth the current price of $49.
summary: Cute bag, but not worth the money

Came past me wrists so I know after a couple of Washington it would still fit. Now the one very big CON the washing instructions! Hand wash, hang dry, do not wring or dry clean. A little too much work to wash this type of shirt. The washing instructions are the only reason I can't give this item 5s.

*** I did receive this product at a discount for my honest review ***
Wow! Beautiful. Excellent craftsmanship. Thick lining. Beading galore. Lace up back so you have some room to play with. Perfect. Thinly of ordering other colors as well.
Beautiful dress

I got this shirt for my husband to wear to work since he not only likes to dress professional, but also 'business casual' on certain days. He liked the unique design of this shirt and was excited to receive it.

- True to size. My son usually wears between a medium to a large (if it runs on the smaller side). He is 5'10 and 155 lbs. We ordered a large for him, and it was just slightly loose (as most US larges are on him).

- Feels light and airy. The material this shirt is made out of feels nice and soft. He said it was really comfortable.

- Durable and well-made. The sewing stitch seems nicely done and of good quality, as well as the fabric and overall appearance (no rips, split seams, etc. at all)

CONS:

- The only con for this shirt is that the sleeves do seem to run a bit long. With that being said, my husband prefers to roll his sleeves up anyway, so it didn't bother him.

Overall, we're very happy with this shirt.

*I only review products that I am genuinely interested in and have used, tested, tried. My opinion will always be 100% honest - if I love it, you'll know, if I don't, it will definitely reflect in my review. With that being said, I did receive this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.*
summary: Very Comfy and True to Size

reviewText:
Outside of running a bit towards the leaner, not a significant problem, but for a man like my husband -- someone who likes a little room to breathe in his shirts -- you might want to order one size larger and let the wash take care of the excess. ;)

Like I said, beyond that, these shirts exemplify QUALITY.  The material is exquisite.  Soft against the skin, there's NOTHING cheap or thin about it.  The shirt hit my husband at just the right spot, about two or three inches past his hips.  There are buttons that close over the throat, but the shirt looks just as nice when loosened.

All in all, it's a sexy shirt for going out or staying in!  Wear it with jeans, or throw on a pair of slacks and take it to the office.  It's just that versatile!

Bought these shades to see how well the classic design would fare on my head before investing in a pair of Ray-Ban Clubmasters. I fell in love with these the moment I took them out of the package. The glasses themselves looked amazing and felt durable, despite the completely plastic body (maybe even the "glass" itself). Over the weeks, the frames began getting extremely flimsy and the "glass" or whatever it may be, got covered in scratches. There is no UV protection whatsoever, so these will do a number on your vision after extended wear. If you're a person that hates to be called out on, do NOT buy these, as everybody that sees these will call them fake.. or my personal favorite; "swap meet Ray-Bans". If you only care about looks, these are the sunglasses for you. If durability, feel, (and branding) is important to you, save the $10 for a pair of Ray-Bans...you won't regret it.

I bought two different pairs and they are both terrible. I don't know if they actually helped with blocking some of the sunlight or if it just gave everything a different hue. Regardless they are made with really cheap plastic and are quite smaller than expected. Don't waste money on these.

Look good on me and a good replication of the Clubmaster, so I'll keep them.  But honestly the quality is no better than a pair bought at the dollar store.
If it lasts through the summer I'll be happy and surprised.

reviewText: love these!!!!

These are wonderful in every way, I am SO happy with them. The price was great, the pattern is unique and exactly as pictured, the fabric is so nice and soft and comfy, the fit is a TINY bit small on me but for something with no sizing options it's great (somehow I've had really incredible luck with these 'free size'/one size type leggings from China, I see a lot of reviews from people who received pairs that were ridiculously tiny so I consider myself extremely lucky to have fit well in most of the ones I've bought, and these are no exception).

I'm 5'8, about 140lbs, and usually a large in leggings or currently like a 7 in jeans, and these were long enough for me (which can definitely be an issue for me more frequently than I'd like) as well as wide enough. They're just a teensy bit tight around my waist but not uncomfortably so. As with most of these 'one size' type leggings I think I'm at the higher end of what they'll fit, they're very stretchy and soft so I think someone just a little bigger would be able to fit them comfortably, or possibly someone who's quite a bit wider but also a lot shorter. If you're smaller than me I think they'll work great as well since they don't start out very big when unstretched.

Also,  while this is kind of random, I really liked the packaging these came in. It wasn't really anything particularly special, just a resealable ziplock type bag, but I thought it was a nice touch - especially on an item that was so affordable.

I really love these leggings and I'd totally recommend them, I'm even considering getting them in another pattern. As with most of my reviews I included some pictures for reference (and yes, I am standing on a toilet in some of them haha, it was the best view of them I could get) and as always I hope this helps someone (and happy shopping)!

I got these gloves to show off my LGBT Pride!  They work perfectly!  They pair really well with my black tank tops, (I have 25 black tank tops that look exactly the same!!!) I have a cartoon character's wardrobe!  I have about four pairs of the same jeans, two of the same red tank tops, and several black clothes!  I thought these gloves would take away from my gothic fashion but they don't!  These gloves pair well with almost anything!  Just don't wear red, pink, maroon, purple (etc.) with them!  Anything red on top of something purple clashes!  Any other colors would work fantastic!!!  I'd recommend these gloves to anyone who wants a fashionable way to get lots of compliments and show off their LGBT Pride!  Trust me, it works!!!  Also good for anyone who wants to stand out in a crowd!!!
summary: Great for anyone who wants to stand out in a crowd!

I was hoping that this shirt would fit my husband.  I ordered a XXXXL and my husband takes a 3XL in U.S. Sizes, but it did not fit him.  I let my son and grandson try it on, they both wear a 2XL in U.S. Sizes, it didn't fit either one of them.  I gave it to one of my son's friends and it was a little short, but it did fit him!

Here are some measurements that I measured:
   From the top of the shoulder, next to the collar to the bottom of the shirt, it measured about 30 inches long.
   Then I measured it straight across the lower stomach area and it was about 22 inches across, so it would be 44 inches around.
   I measured the upper chest area and it measured 23 inches across, so it would be 46 inches around.
   From the armpit to the cuff it measured, 24 inches.
   The last measurement I did was all the way across the neckline and it measured 18 inches.

The most AWESOME thing about this shirt, is that it was extremely soft!

These shows are just too cute. My son is 13 mo old and of average size (50%) for height. I ordered the size 12-18 mo, even after reading reviews that the shoes run large. My son started walking a month ago and the shoes are just too big for him to walk around in. I figured that we would want hard sole shoes by the time he could fit into these, so I am exchanging them for the smaller size, 6-12 mo. This first picture shows a 12 to 18 mo shoe on the left and a 6 to 12 mo show on the right. There is a 2 cm difference in length. Honestly, I think it would be perfect if they had a shoe size for in between these two. The smaller size does fit my son very well right now. The second picture shows this shoe and the Liam (which I also love). The difference in these shoes which are the same size (6-12mo )is about 1 cm. So one style might fit your child better than the other.

****update****

reviewText: Just purchased this belt last week and am extremely happy with it so far. My old belt was starting to stratch and get mishaped (started to turn circular rather than flat). I was slightly skeptical at first, but thought I'd give it a try. First impression of the strap material was "no way this is strong enough" - however I was wrong. I put the belt on and tugged on it from various directions, only to find myself being pulled in that direction. Buckle holds the strap tightly and doesn't loosen. Best part about this belt is that it is sized for me, and not relying on selecting a hole that leaves the belt too loose or too tight. So long as the belt holds up over time, I will be recommending this to many others, and adding more variety to my collection.
summary: Skepticism put in it's place by this belt.
